entry.title: √úberblick und Updates 2025 f√ºr SAP Training und Zertifizierungen
entry.content:
SAP Trainingsangebote und Lern-Formate 

Die SAP-Welt entwickelt sich st√§ndig weiter, und mit ihr auch die Anforderungen an SAP Fachkr√§fte. Um diesem Wandel gerecht zu werden, bietet SAP ein breites Spektrum an Trainingsm√∂glichkeiten an. Von formellen Schulungen bis hin zu digitalen Lernformaten ist f√ºr jeden Lerntyp etwas dabei.  

Trainergef√ºhrte Kurse finden im Schulungszentrum, virtuell oder hybrid statt. Daneben gibt es Akademien und Schulungskonferenzen, die sich auf spezifische Themen wie Security oder Finanzen konzentrieren (diese werden im 2ten Halbjahr 2025 stattfinden). SAP bietet zudem ma√ügeschneiderte Schulungen vor Ort oder im Schulungszentrum an.  

Eine besonders flexible Option ist das "3 to Run"-Programm, bei dem Kunden einen Wunschtermin f√ºr eine Schulung vorschlagen k√∂nnen, sobald sich mindestens drei Teilnehmer gefunden haben. Dies erm√∂glicht eine bedarfsgerechte Terminplanung. Zur √úbersicht √ºber laufende Kurse bietet sich der SAP Trainings-Kalender an.  

Digitale SAP Lernangebote 

Im Bereich der digitalen Lernangebote hat SAP in den letzten Jahren stark investiert. Die Plattform learning.sap.com bietet eine Vielzahl kostenfreier Lerninhalte zum Selbststudium an. Hier wird zunehmend alles an Lern-Angeboten zentralisiert - so sind z.B. die openSAP Kurse schon in dem Bereich aufgegangen.  

F√ºr ein noch umfassenderes Lernerlebnis steht der SAP Learning Hub zur Verf√ºgung, das digitale Premium Lern-Angebot. Besonders hervorzuheben sind die √ºber 600 Live-Sessions pro Quartal, die in verschiedenen Formaten angeboten werden, die Learning Analytics Dashboards sowie die mehr als 340 vorkonfigurierten √úbungssysteme, die praktisches Hands-on-Learning erm√∂glichen. Auch sind vier Zertifizierungsversuche inkludiert, sowie das Ablegen einer Rezertifizierung. 

Neue SAP Schulungen und Lernangebote 

F√ºr 2025 sind zahlreiche neue Angebote geplant. Neue Kurse gibt es beispielsweise zu Themen wie Terraform auf SAP BTP, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Administration of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (ADM001) oder Introduction to SAP Business Technology Platform‚ÄØAdministration (ADMCLD).  

Ein Highlight ist auch der Change Management Workshop SAP Change Basecamp, in dem Change Management Aktivit√§ten entlang einer  Fallstudie erarbeitet werden.  

Auch gibt es Updates in den √úbungssystemen.  So wurde das User Interface vereinfacht und der Zugang und die Navigation zu den Kursmaterialien auf der‚ÄØSAP Learning-Seite wurde angepasst, um Ihnen im Bereich ‚ÄûMein Lernen‚Äú zus√§tzliche Informationen zu bieten. Daneben gibt es regelm√§√üig neue √úbungssysteme, so gibt es jetzt SAP Joule als Teil der‚ÄØSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚ÄØSandbox. 

Informationen zu verschiedenen neuen Lernangeboten gibt es monatlich im SAP Learning Newsletter.    

SAP-Zertifizierung 

Im Bereich der SAP-Zertifizierung gab es in letzter Zeit gr√∂√üere Neuerungen. Der Fokus liegt nun st√§rker auf Rollen und Skills, statt nur auf Produktkenntnissen. Das Zertifizierungsangebot wurde gestrafft, um relevanter und √ºbersichtlicher zu sein.  

Eine wichtige √Ñnderung ist die Einf√ºhrung des Stay-Certified Modells, bei dem eine j√§hrliche Rezertifizierung erforderlich ist. Dies stellt sicher, dass Zertifizierte stets auf dem neuesten Stand der Technologie bleiben. Der Umfang ist jedoch mit ca. 20-30 Min. Pr√ºfungszeit und unlimitierten Versuchen um einiges geringer wie bei einer initialen Zertifizierung, die schon 3 Stunden lange dauern kann.  

F√ºr SAP-Partner gibt es neuerdings besondere Anforderungen. Bestimmte Schl√ºsselrollen in RISE-Projekten m√ºssen bis Juni 2025 g√ºltige Zertifizierungen vorweisen. Zudem m√ºssen bis Ende 2025 50% der relevanten Partner-Ressourcen eine g√ºltige SAP Solution Portfolio Zertifizierung haben. 

Eine innovative Neuerung ist das Format "Hands-on-Learning Real-World Validation". Hierbei m√ºssen Teilnehmer f√ºr bestimmte Zertifizierungen praktische √úbungen durchf√ºhren, um ihr Wissen in realen Szenarien unter Beweis zu stellen.  

Zur Vorbereitung f√ºr eine Zertifizierung ist auch die neue Get Certified Live Session-Serie hilfreich, in welchen - erg√§nzend zum Selbststudium √ºber die digitalen Learning Journeys - erfahrene SAP Trainer die relevantesten Themen zu einer ausgew√§hlten SAP-Zertifizierung in einer Reihe von Live-Sessions vorstellen und Tips und Tricks zur Pr√ºfung teilen. Diese Get Certified Live Session Tracks f√ºhren die Lerner effizient durch die digitalen Learning Journeys. Die Neuerungen und vor allem viele Fragen & Antworten wurden hier im Blog zusammengefasst.  

Vorteilspakete f√ºr die SAP Weiterbildung 

SAP bietet verschiedene Vorteilspakete an. Die Preferred Card funktioniert wie eine Guthabenkarte mit einem Rabattmodell. Je h√∂her die Vorauszahlung, desto gr√∂√üer der Rabatt. Das Learning Plus Package ist ein Rahmenvertrag f√ºr Schulungen und Zertifizierungen, der l√§nder√ºbergreifend genutzt werden kann und sich besonders f√ºr Gro√üunternehmen eignet. F√ºr beides gibt es derzeit √ºbrigens noch weitere Prozente 

Ein besonders interessantes Angebot ist die SAP Training Flatrate. F√ºr einen Jahresbetrag erhalten Teilnehmer unbegrenzten Zugang zu Klassenraumtrainings. Dies kann besonders f√ºr Juniorberater oder Neueinsteiger attraktiv sein, die sich intensiv in SAP-Themen einarbeiten m√∂chten. Weitere Infos gibt es auf der Seite zu "Special Offers". 

Good-Practices rund um SAP Training  

F√ºr ein effektives Lernen empfehlen wir folgende Best Practices: 

  • Nutzt die Learning Journeys zur Orientierung und zur Planung des individuellen Lernpfads. 
  • Kombiniert selbstgesteuertes E-Learning mit Live-Sessions oder Klassenraumtrainings f√ºr ein optimales Lernergebnis. 
  • Tauscht Euch in Communities aus und nutzt Sie die M√∂glichkeit, in Live-Sessions Fragen zu stellen. 
  • √úbt praktisch in den Hands-on-Systemen, um theoretisches Wissen zu festigen und anzuwenden. 
  • Testet Euer Wissen √ºber Zertifizierungen und regelm√§√üige Rezertifizierung. 

Zusammenfassung 

SAP hat sein Trainings- und Zertifizierungsangebot in den letzten Jahren erweitert und flexibilisiert. Von klassischen Schulungen bis hin zu digitalen Lernformaten gibt es je nach Lernbed√ºrfnis verschiedene M√∂glichkeiten. Die Einf√ºhrung des Stay Certified Modells und die neuen Anforderungen f√ºr Partner zeigen, dass aktuelle Expertise und lebenslanges Lernen immer wichtiger wird.  

Weitere Lern-Quellen und Events 

SAP bietet verschiedene M√∂glichkeiten, um auf dem Laufenden zu bleiben. Dazu geh√∂rt der monatliche Newsletter, die SAP Community Gruppe in deutsch und englisch und auf LinkedIn die Gruppe f√ºr SAP Training und Change Management. Ein besonderes Highlight ist das j√§hrliche SAP Learning and Adoption Forum, das am 25. Juni in Walldorf und virtuell stattfindet.

entry.title: Free SAP Certification and practice systems for students & lecturers
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

It‚Äôs great to announce that SAP learning hub, student edition is now live for actively enrolled students and faculty only. It includes:

  • ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇAll course content available in the customer subscription of SAP Learning Hub
  • ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇTwo free certification exam attempts
  • ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇLive session access
  • ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇStay certified content
  • ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇAccess to cloud-based training systems (Gated to cloud only)

Have your university portal login information and student ID ready, and:

Students can register here for free

Lecturers can register here for free

 

If you have no idea what SAP is about and why you should even bother with this, check out this blog I posted on the topic to get a rough idea on what you are starting here.

 

How to get started:

 

1: Creating your SAP Universal ID (UID)

Start on the registration page.

A universal ID is what you need to register and track your learning progress. Be sure to use the email address associated with your university enrollment.  We recommend adding a second email address to this if you will be trying out for certification. If you already have a UID, you can log in with it and skip this step.

 

Note 1: Instructions on how to add a second email address can be found at the start of the certification exam scheduling demo.

Note 2: Be sure to never share your UID credentials with anyone.

 

 

2: Verify yourself as a student (or faculty)

We have a checkpoint in place to ensure you are an actively enrolled student  to continue registering. Please verify with the email address that is associated with your university enrollment.

If you have an email address provided to you by your university, use that one. If not, use the email address the university has on record for you. Be prepared with the login information for your university portal and/or your student ID before triggering the verification process. You will not be able to proceed without it.

Note 1: the trick of using your old student email address from 10 years ago doesn‚Äôt apply here. üòä You must be actively enrolled at your educational institution at the time of registration to proceed.

Note 2: To avoid any confusion‚Äîdon‚Äôt mix up the verification email confirmation with the subscription activation link. The activation link might take one business day to show up in your inbox. Once it does, click on it to unlock your certification attempts and access to the hands-on system.

Note 3: For any support with document upload or the verification process in general, please click here.

3: Start Learning

While waiting for your subscription activation email, you can still get a head start with studying. To get oriented, visit the student zone.

 

4: Activate your subscription

Keep an eye on your inbox for your subscription activation link from ‚ÄúSAP ID Service‚Äù. If it doesn‚Äôt show up after 3-4 days, be sure to check your spam folder.

Note 1: If you do not receive your activation email after 4 days, go to the bottom of our support page and create a support case.

Note 2: If you encounter the message pictured below after clicking the activation link, just clear your browser cache and try the link again.

 

5: Continue studying & other tips to get the most out of the platform

If you haven‚Äôt started a learning journey yet, you can pick one in the student zone.

To continue studying learning journeys that you have already started, go here.

After you finish a learning journey in the carousel series that you started, you will have to go to the student zone to pick the next one:

 

 

6: Get hands-on

Hands on system practice is as important as the certification itself. You must be able to do at least some basic system navigation and activities on the solution you are studying for:

 

7: Register for live sessions

Take the opportunity to listen to and talk to experts in the field you have chosen. These sessions are either recordings from the past or events that will take place in the future:

Note: Join me in one of my scheduled onboarding live sessions here! 

8: Schedule your certification exam

Once you are ready to schedule your exam, select the certification tile at the end of the carousel and get started:

Note: If you have any further questions about SAP Certification, check out the SAP Certification support center.

 

Some FAQs

I don‚Äôt have a university-provided email address. What do I do?    

Answer: Sign up with the email address that your university has on record. Be prepared to upload digital copies of any identification or documents which can prove enrolment in your educational institution. 

 

I am no longer a student, but I have an old university email address. Can I gain access with that?    

Answer: Unfortunately, no. We verify that you are actively enrolled in an educational institution.

 

I am stuck at the student/lecturer verification step! How do I find help?

Answer: Reach out to SheerID support here.

 

Where can I post questions about the learning material that I‚Äôm studying?

Post your questions in the SAP Community learning group.

If you have a technical problem, go to the help center.

 

Can I access all the training systems that SAP has to offer?    

Answer:‚ÄØNo, access to training systems on SAP Learning Hub, student edition is restricted to cloud-based systems only.

 

How long do I have access to this free subscription?

Answer: 12 months. You can renew it if you are still actively enrolled in your university.

 

Can I certify in two different topics?

Answer: Yes.If you pass on the first attempt, you can use your second exam attempt for a different exam.

 

What should I start studying?

Answer: If you don't have a particular solution in mind and are looking for a basic credential to prove your seriousness around learning SAP, start here:

1. Discovering SAP for Students

2. Positioning SAP Business Suite for Students - This is exclusive and visible only for actively enrolled students and faculty who successfully register for SAP Learning Hub, student edition. See steps 2 & 4 above. See this blog for a more detailed breakdown on how to achieve this certification quickly.

Best of luck in your studies! 

Regards,

David

entry.title: SAP Certification for Partners: An Overview of the Latest Changes - Including Q&A
entry.content:
On March 19, Suzanne Heiob, SAP Certification Product Management, and Axel Meinke, Partner Enablement Manager MEE, invited SAP partners to provide information on the latest updates in the SAP certification program. The German session offered insights into the transformation of the certification program and introduced a range of updates. It also provided space for questions and discussion. To help you as partners prepare for the new requirements, here is a focused summary of the webinar content and related questions from the Q&A.

 

What's New in the SAP Certification Program?

A key change in the certification program is the focus on role-based certifications. The goal is to align the skills of SAP partners precisely with practical requirements. The new certifications cover critical roles such as Enterprise Architects and Implementation Consultants, which were not sufficiently represented in the past due to the strong product focus. In addition, certifications that are no longer relevant have been removed from the portfolio to focus on supporting cloud deployments and S/4HANA transformations.

 

Additional Certification Requirements for SAP Partners

By July 2025, all partner resources in key roles ‚Äì enterprise architects, developers, business transformation management consultants, project managers involved in RISE with SAP projects ‚Äì must have a valid SAP certification. By the end of 2025, it is expected that 50% of relevant partner practitioners will hold at least one valid certification in the SAP solution portfolio. Overall, this means that SAP partners will need to continuously update and expand their skills.

 

The 'Get- and Stay-Certified' Model

Starting April 2024, certifications will need to be renewed annually through a ‚ÄòStay-Certified‚Äô assessment. This short quiz generally requires up to two hours of learning effort, lasts 20‚Äì30 minutes, and extends the certification by 12 months. This is particularly important for those who wish to retain their certifications after March 31, 2025, as without taking such an assessment, the certification status will expire.

Continuous proof of knowledge ensures that experts are always up to date with SAP innovations. This secures both the quality of SAP projects and individual competitiveness in the job market. To make this visible, there are digital badges available for both completing certifications and completing Learning Journeys (including a short self-test). These badges can be shared on LinkedIn or viewed on Credly.

 

SAP Universal ID: Simplified Certification Transfer

An important innovation is the introduction of the SAP Universal ID. This ID is a lifelong personal identifier that facilitates the management of certifications across different employers. At least two different email addresses, including a private one, must be linked to activate the Universal ID. This ensures that access to the ID remains even when switching companies.

 

SAP Learning Hub and Certification

A subscription to SAP Learning Hub includes access to all SAP learning materials and four certification attempts per year. The costs for the initial certification and the 'Stay Certified' assessments are included in the SAP Learning Hub subscription. A certification remains valid for 12 months as long as regular assessments are passed. Re-certification does not require a certification voucher and can be attempted an unlimited number of times.

Live sessions in SAP Learning Hub are particularly helpful for exam preparation, such as the 'Structured Guided Learning' or 'Stay Certified' formats. Furthermore, you gain access to pre-configured training systems for practical exercises. With a subscription to SAP Learning Hub, you are well equipped: You have the flexibility to design your learning times individually, prepare for exams, and take them. This combination of independent learning, practical exercise opportunities in test environments, and interactive sessions ensures that you are optimally prepared for your certifications.

The Learning Hub Adoption Dashboard is also a valuable tool that allows learning managers to monitor and manage the certification transformation within the company. Here you can view relevant information about the learning and certification status of your employees and coordinate necessary steps to secure certification status before the deadline.

 

Q&A from the Session (originially in German, translated below)

Universal ID

 

I have a question about the Universal ID. Why do I need to link two email addresses? And why must the two email addresses have different domains? This results in needing to link a private email address for everyone requiring a Universal SAP ID.

The purpose of the second email is for recovery, in case you lose your access credentials. It's recommended to use a private email as a recovery option because the UID accompanies you throughout your career (unlike the old user model where S-Users, for example, belonged to the employer).

If you're experiencing the error: "Can't see your certifications? Your emails linked to SAP Universal ID are not verified.‚Äù How can you verify your email if it has been the associated email for years?

 

You should have received a verification email to the corresponding address. If it's not there, please check your spam folder.

 

Certification

 

Where can I find an overview of which certifications already exist in my company?

If you're a Learning Manager, you can request the reporter role for the Learning Hub Dashboard by submitting a ticket. You'll find an overview of your certified consultants under Certifications (provided the learners have a license for SAP Learning Hub).

I have certifications under different S-User/C-User accounts. What do I need to do to transfer these certifications to the new UID?

You need to generate the UID and add the certified S-/P-Users (simple context menu ‚Äì "Add User" in the process).

Do certifications obtained without LH not count for the company?

They do count ‚Äì you can also directly purchase certification attempts. Re-certification is only possible via SAP LH.

Is there an overview of certifications available without Learning Hub access?

You can find an overview of all certifications here: https://learning.sap.com/certifications?page=1. The overview of your certified learners, regardless of SAP Learning Hub licenses, can also be found in SAP for Me.

Can a certification completed in 2022 on an old Universal ID (with a previous employer) be transferred to a new one, and if so, how?The UID does not belong to an employer like the user in the old model but is personal to you. In your case, you simply need to add the S-User ID of your new employer to your existing UID.

It has recently been communicated that special certification requirements are being imposed on SAP partners. What (type) of certifications are specifically needed? Are there must-have certifications?

For partners, certifications listed in the Partner Competency Framework are particularly relevant: https://partneredge.sap.com/en/partnership/manage/competency/requirements.html

What does the status "certified stay" ‚Äúcompleted‚Äù and ‚Äúin progress‚Äù mean?

The status "completed" does not exist. We have on SAP Learning the status "up to date" when someone is valid with their current certification and the due date is a long time away. Then there is "Stay certified due", when the due date is within the next two weeks.

Currently, it's still possible to purchase certification attempts separately without LH. At the end of last year, SAP communicated frequently that a license for SAP Learning Hub will soon be mandatory and that certifications cannot be acquired mid-term without Learning Hub. Is there a clear, definitive statement from SAP on this matter? Can certification attempts still be purchased separately without a license for SAP Learning Hub?

"Stay certified": this requires a valid SAP Learning Hub subscription.

 

"Stay Certified": this requires a valid SAP Learning Hub subscription.

 

There is a separate package with 2 standalone certification attempts. These attempts can only be used for the initial certification. Delays for extending validity must subsequently be completed through LH; therefore, LH is necessary long-term to remain certified.

Is there an overview listing which certifications bring how many points towards partner status? How do we know which certifications will be retired and which will remain?

The Partner Competency Framework can be found here: https://partneredge.sap.com/en/partnership/manage/competency/requirements.html

 

The list of all certifications can be found here: https://learning.sap.com/certifications?page=1. Any certifications not listed there have already been retired.

If the exam for re-certification is not completed by March 31, 2025, can the exam still be taken later?

Yes, but you lose your status and are no longer certified until you pass the new exam. Instead of simply taking the shorter re-certification test, you need to get fully certified again.

The News Alert states "By July this year, all partner resources in key roles ‚Äì such as enterprise architects, developers, business transformations management consultants, and project managers involved in RISE with SAP projects ‚Äì must have a valid SAP certification." Which certifications are specifically meant here?

You can find an overview of the necessary training and certifications for GROW and RISE in the following link: https://partneredge.sap.com/en/partnership/manage/competency/requirements.html

 

Is the competency relevance of a certificate visible only in the Learning Hub Adoption Dashboard or is this overview available outside of this dashboard?

The Partner Competency Framework can also be found here: https://partneredge.sap.com/en/partnership/manage/competency.html

Can we use certifications from our external consultants? Even if they are not employed by us?

 

Once the external consultant receives an S-User from your company and links this S-User to their SAP Universal ID, this certification will also be counted for your company.

How is the certification status of consultants in projects verified?

Via the Digital Badge, which indicates whether a consultant is still validly certified.

What does the status "Completed" mean in SAP for me?

Someone has completed the stay certified assessment and extended their certification.

What does "Stay certified" = "In Progress" mean?

This means that the learner has created a Universal ID but has yet to pass an assessment.

Are there new or additional certifications for authorization consultants planned?

Currently, no new certification is planned. Here is the portal to check if there is a successor for a specific certification: https://www.sap.com/certificationfinder

Learning Manager

 

How do I become a Learning Manager or nominate others?

Initially in the contract ‚Äì for further nominations, information can be found here: https://partneredge.sap.com/en/partnership/manage/training/certified.html

What resources are available for Learning Managers?

The Learning Manager Hub (https://partneredge.sap.com/en/partnership/manage/training/certified.html)in the Partner Portal provides Q&A, email templates, and other helpful resources.

SAP Learning Hub

 

When I want to log in to the Learning Hub via web, I receive the message "HTTP Status 400 ‚Äì Bad Request." Is there a new link for this? (https://learninghub.sap.com/login)

https://learninghub.sap.com is the official page for the SAP Learning Hub. Issues might also be browser-related. Try using a different browser in case of problems.

I want to know how I can obtain the "Learning Manager" permission.

The "IT Contact Person" automatically gains access to the Learning Analytics Dashboard for all learners. When purchasing, you can request admin authorization for additional users via ticket.

Learning.sap.com

 

Why are there now two pages: Learning.sap.com and Learninghub.sap.com? Will they be merged in the future?

That is the long-term plan. Unfortunately, in the ongoing operation, this can only be gradually adjusted, including the information from training.sap.com that is also being migrated. The goal is to have everything on learning.sap.com. For example, openSAP courses, certification information, and more have already been migrated there. It is increasingly becoming the single point of access, where some content or features, such as re-certification or hands-on systems, live sessions, are only accessible through the Learning Hub subscription.

 

Additional Resources

You can find more information and details on the topic at the following addresses ‚Äì feel free to browse:

  • German materials from the session can be found here: Recording & Slides
  • SAP Learning Hub ‚Äì Overview of the Learning Platform
  • Overview of all SAP certifications
  • SAP Certification Finder: Find the right certification for your needs
  • SAP Certification on learning.sap.com: Your central entry point
  • Partner Competency Framework: All requirements for SAP partners
  • Stay updated on training and certification with the SAP Learning Newsletter (German version here)!

Do you have questions? Feel free to leave them in the comments!

entry.title: KI-gest√ºtzte Automatisierung f√ºr End-User Learning und Content-Entwicklung
entry.content:
Die Herausforderung bei der KI-Nutzung im Lernbereich

Moritz Huber, verantwortlich bei SAP f√ºr Learning Services in der Region Mittel und Osteuropa, pr√§sentierte in der  Community Session am 24.04. einen SAP Proof of Concept f√ºr KI-gest√ºtzte Entwicklung von SAP-Trainingsbedarfsanalysen und -Lerninhalten. Dieser Ansatz nutzt generative KI, um ma√ügeschneiderte Schulungsmaterialien zu erstellen, die auf die Bed√ºrfnisse von SAP User abgestimmt sind.

Melanie strukturierte ihren Impuls entlang der drei klassischen Change-Phasen Prepare, Manage und Sustain und ging zu Beginn auf das Big Picture der Change Journey einer F√ºhrungskraft ein:

 

Phase 1 - Prepare: Das Fundament f√ºr erfolgreichen Wandel

In der Vorbereitungsphase steht die Bewusstseinsbildung im Mittelpunkt. F√ºhrungskr√§fte m√ºssen sich zun√§chst ihrer eigenen Haltung zum Change bewusst werden und das "Warum" der Ver√§nderung klar definieren. Melanie beschrieb das Beispiel von einem S/4-Projekt Change Impact Workshops mit F√ºhrungskr√§ften, um auf strategischer Ebene die Ver√§nderungen in Prozessen und Daten zu verstehen. Daraus entstand ein gemeinsames Zielbild, das sp√§ter mit den Teams zu konkreten "Month in the Life of..."-Szenarien weiterentwickelt wurde.

Ein besonders wirkungsvolles Tool in dieser Phase erwies sich das Team Canvas: Darin werden Rollen, Verantwortlichkeiten und der gemeinsame Purpose partizipativ erarbeitet, um von Beginn an Orientierung und Einbindung zu schaffen. In den folgenden Illustrierungen der jeweiligen Phase sind die Leitfragen und Aufgaben f√ºr F√ºhrungskr√§fte jeweils in einer Box, die Aufgaben f√ºr Change & Learning Leads in einem Pfeil illustriert.

Phase 2 - Manage: Skills und Mindset entwickeln

Die Umsetzungsphase fokussiert auf die gezielte Kompetenzentwicklung von F√ºhrungskraft und Team. Melanie setzte beispielsweise Skill-Matrizen ein, um Kompetenzen in den Bereichen Prozess, Daten und Soft Skills sichtbar zu machen und systematisch zu entwickeln. Phase 3 -  Sustain: Nachhaltigkeit durch Rituale und Communities

Die nachhaltige Verankerung erfolgt durch bewusst etablierte Rituale. Die Learning Hours wurden nach Projektende von der Fachabteilung √ºbernommen und in regul√§re Quartal -Calls integriert. Besonders wichtig erwies sich das bewusste Feiern von Erfolgen ‚Äì von Go-Live-Partys mit Vorstand und Teamvideos bis hin zu gemeinsamen Aktivit√§ten nach erfolgreichen Meilensteinen. Diese Rituale verst√§rken das Gef√ºhl des gemeinsam Erreichten und motivieren f√ºr kommende Herausforderungen.

 

Diskussion und Austausch mit den Teilnehmenden / Themen

Zusammenspiel Change Agent - F√ºhrungskraft

Die Zusammenarbeit zwischen F√ºhrungskraft und Change Agent wurde intensiv diskutiert. In globalen Projekten agieren Change Agents als Multiplikatoren in Lokationen oder Fachbereichen mit regelm√§√üiger zentraler Abstimmung, w√§hrend F√ºhrungskr√§fte in gezielten Einzelgespr√§chen individuell abgeholt werden.

Zum Einsatz von KI-Tools im Change Management sieht Melanie durchaus Potenzial, etwa bei Coaching Apps oder Meetingauswertungen. Aktuell arbeitet sie jedoch haupts√§chlich mit bew√§hrten Tools wie PowerPoint, SharePoint und Forms, da viele KI-Anwendungen noch in der Entwicklung sind.

Melanie betonte, dass Peer Learning im S/4HANA-Projektteam gezielt eingesetzt wurde, um Wissen, Erfahrungen und Best Practices team√ºbergreifend zu teilen und beschrieb, dass dies durch regelm√§√üige, niederschwellige Austauschformate wie Lernzirkel oder kurze w√∂chentliche Sessions erfolgte, in denen Teams aktuelle Arbeitsergebnisse pr√§sentierten.

Das Thema Change-m√ºdigkeit und √úberlastung besch√§ftigt viele Organisationen. Melanie betonte die Bedeutung von Einzelgespr√§chen zur individuellen Betreuung und die Nutzung von Feedback als Steuerungsinstrument. entry.title: Your Step-by-Step Guide to SAP Sales Cloud V2 Certification
entry.content:
The SAP Certified Associate - Implementation Consultant - SAP Sales Cloud Version 2   exam is designed for professionals who want to demonstrate their ability to configure, implement, and use the  new SAP Sales Cloud solution. With organizations increasingly relying on cloud-based sales tools, this credential sets you apart as someone who can deliver value through modern, intelligent sales processes.

If you‚Äôre planning to pursue this certification, here‚Äôs a structured roadmap using the official resources available.

Step 1: Start with the Learning Journey

Your first stop should be the Learning Journey: Implementing SAP Sales Cloud V2. This guided path introduces you to the fundamentals and provides structured exercises to practice key business user and configuration skills.

The Learning Journey covers the essentials:

  • Daily workflows for sales representatives and managers
  • Core capabilities and navigation of Sales Cloud V2
  • Machine learning fundamentals and generative AI overview
  • Integration with Microsoft Teams and mobile app functionality

By following it through, you‚Äôll gain both conceptual understanding and practical hands-on experience.

Step 2: Join the ‚ÄúGet Certified‚Äù Live Session Series

Next, enroll in the ‚ÄúGet Certified: SAP Certified Associate ‚Äì Implementation Consultant ‚Äì SAP Sales Cloud V2‚Äù live session series. These structured, expert-led sessions are designed to complement your independent study with:

  • A Kickoff session (1 hour), which walks through exam format, question types, preparation strategies, and sample questions

  • A series of five additional 1-hour sessions, each focusing on key Learning Journey units

By participating, you gain direct guidance from certified trainers, reinforce your understanding of the most exam-relevant content, and practice with realistic sample questions‚Äîall of which are invaluable for aligning study with exam demands.

Step 3: Optional Microlearning Videos for Just-in-Time Insights

If you‚Äôd like to reinforce particular areas or learn on the go, consider exploring the bite-sized microlearning videos  in the Sales Cloud V2 category. These videos are concise, accessible, and perfect for filling knowledge gaps just when you need it.

Step 4: Hands-on Practical Test (Required to Unlock Exam Booking)

Before you can book the certification exam, SAP requires proof of hands-on competence. This is fulfilled by the ‚ÄúDemonstrating the Value of SAP Sales Cloud Version 2‚Äù practical test within your Learning Journey. 

If you have gone through the Learning Journey exercises, this step should be straightforward. The tasks in the test are based on what you‚Äôve already practiced, making it a natural extension of your preparation. Once passed, the ‚ÄúSchedule Exam‚Äù button becomes available, allowing you to book your certification exam. 

Step 5: Prepare for the Certification Exam

Next, focus your preparation on the exam content itself:

  • Implementation basics and clean-core principles
  • Master data management (accounts, contacts, products, pricing)
  • Sales processes including leads, opportunities, contracts, quotations, and orders
  • User management, personalization, and security
  • Use this framework to guide your revision and ensure full coverage.

Step 5: Practice and Review

After completing the learning resources, reinforce your knowledge through practice:

  • Revisit exercises in the Learning Journey

  • Test yourself with sample exam questions, if available

Consistent review will help you move from memorization to confident application of concepts.

Final Thoughts

The path to SAP Sales Cloud V2 certification is clear when you use the right resources. Start with the Learning Journey, take advantage of quarterly expert sessions and study according to the exam guide. By combining structured learning with consistent practice, you‚Äôll be ready to validate your expertise and move forward as a trusted SAP Sales Cloud consultant.
